activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brianda N. Morga

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

8:56 AM Defendant Brianda N. Morga not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant on defendant's non-appearance. BODY ONLY. Reviewable by any Court Official. 8:58AM  Defendant Brianda N. Morga in court.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court vacates warrant. Sworn testimony by defendant.  Court finds the defendant indigent. Court appoints attorney Joseph Freier, defendant to pay $100/month for attorney fee. Status Conference November 22 2022 at 1:15PM
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 08:45 am.

2:45 PM   Defendant Brianda N. Morga appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court considers defendant standing mute and enters not guilty plea.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brianda N. Morga appeared by video. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $1000 Signature bond with conditions: Not to possess any animals during the pendency of case. Defendant must sign bond anytime between Wednesday, August 18 through Friday, August 19, 2022. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022.
Not to possess any animals during the pendency of case
Initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
